'''Urubamba''' is a Master Trainer located in {{Location|Atocpan}}. To unlock his [[Warrior's Challenge]], the player must first complete the [[Hidden Exploration Objective]] ''[[Little Lost Saurians]]''. 

Completing Urubamba's Warrior's Challenge with S grade or higher grants the {{Achievement|I Am Speed}}. It is also one of the requirements for unlocking the quest ''[[Someday, We All Must Walk Alone]]''.

==Dialogue==
===Dialogue Set #1===
Available after completing ''[[Little Lost Saurians]]''.
{{Dialogue Start}}
;(Talk to Urubamba)
:'''Urubamba:''' Kind warrior, all my saurians are safe and sound, and all thanks to you!
:'''Urubamba:''' You've shown such courage and kindness that I, Urubamba, would be honored to help you train for the [[Warrior's Challenge]], completely free of charge!
:{{DIcon|Warrior's Challenge}} Let's begin!
:;(Opens Warrior's Challenge interface)
:{{DIcon}} Give me a moment to prep...
{{Dialogue End}}

===Dialogue Set #2===
Available during the Warrior's Challenge.
{{Dialogue Start}}
;(Talk to Urubamba)
:'''Urubamba:''' Once you've made up your mind, don't think too much about it. Just give it your all!
{{Dialogue End}}

===Dialogue Set #3===
Available after completing the Warrior's Challenge with at least S grade.
{{Dialogue Start}}
;(Talk to Urubamba)
:'''Urubamba:''' Wow, I'd never have guessed you'd do so well &mdash; I clearly underestimated you!
:'''Urubamba:''' To think that after all that preparation, the challenge prizes would end up being scooped up, just like that, by a total stranger passing through... It almost sounds...
:'''Urubamba:''' ...Like one of those heroic tales, straight out of a woven scroll!
:'''Urubamba:''' Maybe someday your heroic deeds will end up being woven into our legends too? In fact, when I put it like that... it sounds quite likely!
:'''Urubamba:''' So, how about a quick selfie together, hero? Who knows, this photo might just become my source of future bragging rights!
:;(The Traveler, Paimon, and [[Little One]] take a photo together)
{{Dialogue End}}

==Trivia==
===Etymology===
* {{w|Sacred Valley}}, also known as "Urubamba Valley", is a valley in the {{w|Andes}} of Peru, north of the {{w|Inca Empire|Inca}} capital of {{w|Cusco}}.
